summary: This is an internal FBI email from the New York office dated November 12, 2021, providing a weekly update. It mentions a visit from new U.S. Attorneys, a counterterrorism conference, and an award given to a detective and special agent for their work on the Jeffrey Epstein sex trafficking investigation. It also notes operational highlights including a guilty verdict in an unrelated case.

persons.name: Damian William
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Recently started as the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York and visited the FBI office to discuss priorities.

persons.name: Breon Peace
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Eastern District of New York
persons.context: Recently assumed the role of U.S. Attorney for the Eastern District of New York and visited the FBI office to discuss priorities.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as a predator in a sex trafficking investigation for which a detective and special agent received an award.

persons.name: Lawrence Lewis
persons.context: Also known as L BOOGZ, found guilty in a digital advertising fraud scheme in an unrelated case (Operation Blood Island).

connections.description: Both are newly appointed U.S. Attorneys (for SDNY and EDNY respectively) who visited the FBI NY office in the same week.

events.title: Guilty verdict in Operation Blood Island case
events.description: A jury returned a guilty verdict against Nine Trey Bloods gang member Lawrence Lewis after a four-week trial in EDNY, Long Island, for a digital advertising fraud scheme.

events.title: FBI NY Friday update email
events.description: Internal FBI email summarizing weekly activities, including visits from U.S. Attorneys, a counterterrorism conference, and an award related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: FBI NY Thanksgiving Lunch
events.description: The FBI NY office's annual Thanksgiving Lunch is scheduled.

keyFacts: An NYPD detective and an FBI special agent received an 'Acts of Valor' award for their work on the Jeffrey Epstein sex trafficking investigation.
The email confirms ongoing FBI and NYPD collaboration on the Epstein case as of November 2021.
New U.S. Attorneys Damian William (SDNY) and Breon Peace (EDNY) had recently started their roles and were briefed on ongoing work.
The document is an internal FBI communication, showing routine operational updates within the bureau.
The award highlights the investigation's focus on seeking justice for the young women victimized by Epstein.
